topics.phrase: I study taunting plaques and statues out of my home.
I live down on Contra-Dextra Avenue and curate mage lore. I have seen several statues in my travels.
The KEY of SILVER lies in the northeast: a silver boar with horns and long fangs. The nearby scrawl—likely elven—warns of ghosts and demons; search the room to take the key.
Seek the KEY of BRONZE in the southeast: a bronze statue—body of a chicken, head of a cat—rests upon an onyx pedestal. Read the plaque, then look around to claim it.
The KEY of BRONZE is required for a checkpoint on the lower level. Do not leave the first floor without it if you intend to press on below. Beware of areas that may teleport...and ghosts as well.
Two squares send travelers into the southeast zone, arriving near E15-N4. One is just west of the arrival door; the other sits off the east run of the central corridor.
The ghosts of MURPHY can appear without end. You cannot run. Use DILTO to dim their sight and grind experience—but bring a party fit to stand.
Guardian Liaison patrolling the Testing Grounds Control Center, responding to bell alarms, and managing Private Elevator access in restricted corridors.
The Testing Grounds Control Center is strictly off-limits; those DO NOT ENTER signs at the Testing Grounds Control Center aren’t for show.
When the bell alarm echoes, guardian monsters mobilize - once that bell alarm hits, you’re in big trouble.
The Private Elevator is for authorized users only; I audit Private Elevator access logs every watch.
I review Treasure Repository security protocols weekly - access to the Treasure Repository is tightly controlled.
Wayfinding archivist decoding mosaics and placards, cataloging strange statues, and mapping rotating floors and fear rooms.
The floor mosaic says turn left, turn right, or turn around - those mosaic turn cues form a hidden route.
That placard sequence - 'A dungeon's dark… when it's not lit… watch out…' - is classic; the placard warning is easy to miss.
I logged the bronze chicken-cat statuette on an onyx pedestal; those pedestal runes around the statuette are unusual.
The bear statuette room labeled 'I’ve got a million of ’em' is a hint - bear statuette lore repeats across levels.
That metal frog statue with a red and blue cape actually twitches - its 'Yeah!!!!' high-pitched call startled me.
Expedition quartermaster tracking lair access, statues, tokens, and other clues.
Secure the Blue Ribbon for Level Transporter access - the Blue Ribbon is your ticket to the transporter room.
Follow the Contra-Dextra Avenue clue from the Arch-Mage Werdna; Contra-Dextra Avenue hints at the route to his lair.
If the sign says 'Lair of the Evil Wizard Werdna - the wizard is in'; treat Werdna’s lair as active.
If the sliding Bear wall blocks the path and forces you outside, you’re missing the proper token for the bear gate.

LLECHY.name: Captain Johne
LLECHY.description: an unkempt man in tattered robes

topics.phrase: I fear the Shadowlords!
Beware!

Years ago, my ship was swallowed by a massive whirlpool. The remains of my ship washed up on this isle with myself and three others. When I recovered, I explored my surroundings, and found a great gem broken into three shards. The Shards, full of evil, drove me to kill my three companions, and from their blood sprang the three Shadowlords.  Taking the Shards deep into this underworld, they entrapped Lord British, and hold Blackthorn in their power. They spare me only to taunt me with such news until my dying day. %0%

LLECHY.name: Drudgeworth
LLECHY.description: a unkempt and pitiful soul with a distant stare.   %0%

topics.phrase: I didn't do it!   %1%
For a crime I did not commit.
I didn't mean to kill 'er! Honest!
Why doesn't they believes me? %1%
'Twer his fault really!
Why, I can show ye where it's hidden!
Lets me out, I'll show ye. %2%

labels.query: Hey, come 'ere! Yer the first soul I've seen in months! Won't ye stay and speak with me a while?

topics.phrase: Chuckles 'ates me! Left me locked up 'ere well beyond me sentence!
Then let me out. I can helps ye!

labels.query: Ye will let me out, won't ye?

topics.phrase: Aye, let's go then.

labels.query: Then go! On yer wretched way,  PIGDOG  ! Just ye wait 'til I get outta this hole! I'll teach ye to mess with ol' Drudgeworth!

LLECHY.name: Kara Montino
LLECHY.description: a level 9 battle mage who cut her teeth in the southwest zone

topics.phrase: I'm a dungeon mage. My job is controlling crowds with KATINO and MONTINO and nuking packs with MAHALITO while keeping an eye on poison cures like LATUMOFIS.
We earned the BLUE RIBBON at the Monster Allocation Center on floor 4 - now the second elevator is open.
On floor 1 I always DISPELL undead kobolds and prep for paralyze or poison just in case.
Once I hit level 9, MAKANITO becomes my go-to answer for crowds that ignore lesser spells.
Bring extra LATUMOFIS.  Breath weapons and enemy casters turn a bad pull into a wipe fast.
I have collected relics in the testing grounds, seen the guardian of the STATUE of BEAR and keeper of the keys and treasure.
If you need experience, challenge MURPHY'S GHOST in the southeast zone - steady gains for disciplined parties.
If you ignore the Testing Grounds Control Center warnings then the guardian monster alarms will bring trouble.
The Treasure Repository is warded - many try the door but nobody in the party can break that door down.  So it is with elevator access too...
Yes, private elevators - authorized users only. Bring proof or be turned away.
I'm a dungeon cartographer - my job is mapping rotating floors, stairs, and chutes, reading mosaic cues, and charting MALOR-safe routes.  I live in the avenue too.
When the floor mosaics say TURN LEFT, TURN RIGHT, or TURN AROUND, trust them - but mark your map.
The Dance Hall’s rotating floors demand patience - wait for warp tiles or scout for one-way doors along the north wall.

topics.query: contra dextra avenue werdna trebor sux plaque
topics.phrase: That ornate plaque hints at Contra-Dextra Avenue - and a classic Werdna taunt to Trebor.
We are room mates..

YEW.name: Nalara
YEW.description: A temple herald devoted to the Earth-god Gnilda

topics.query: job temple herald gnilda shrine staff guide
topics.phrase: My job is temple herald for Gnilda’s shrine, guiding parties through the shrine, the Staff of Gnilda rites, and reciting lore to worthy seekers.

topics.query: sphynx riddle knight of diamonds answer
topics.phrase: For the sphynx riddle, the correct answer is the Knight of Diamonds; remember the sphynx riddle and answer with Knight of Diamonds.

topics.query: apparition gnilda temple words staff five tests
topics.phrase: When the apparition speaks - “Hear these, the words of Gnilda” - it commands that one must acquire the five as proof before receiving the staff.

topics.query: one alone staff of gnilda shrine rule
topics.phrase: The shrine’s rule is “one alone”; only one alone may present the five and bear the Staff of Gnilda.

topics.query: armor clue four steps ahead three steps away
topics.phrase: Follow the armor clue - four steps ahead but three steps away - to locate the armor the quest demands.
The apparition’s charge - hear these words of Gnilda - defines who is worthy in the shrine.
Only the worthy, one alone, may present the five to earn the staff.

YEW.name: Sevrin
YEW.description: An astrologer-sage who sits among dusty tomes, sells insights for a steep fee

topics.query: job astrologer sage dusty tomes stars configuration
topics.phrase: My job is astrologer-sage: I read the stars in dusty tomes and interpret the new configuration that changes spells.
The sage’s fee is 100000 gold - pay 100000 gold and many things will be told.
Under the new stars, sleep lasts longer, silence is stronger, Latumapic has changed, and even Mahaman finds a favorable choice.

topics.query: three roads choose wisely quest path
topics.phrase: Three roads to follow - choose wisely among them lest the quest be forfeit.
In the study you may hear an incantation - Mapiro Mahama Diromat - shouted as familiar magic surges.
At the brick-walled well, wishes cost 5000 GP - Wizicorp will take your 5000 if you’re tempted.
Beware the corridor trap when a panel slams shut behind you.

YEW.name: Aeshma
YEW.description: A leonine riddler who prowls the deepest halls, posing trials about greedy kings and hidden clues

topics.phrase: My job is guardian riddler of the tombs: I ask the sphynx riddle and judge those who seek passage.

topics.query: king worships gold power doom treasure room
topics.phrase: Seek the king who worships gold or power - the king who worships gold will no more see his treasure room, and the king who worships these meets doom.

topics.query: cavern dark inside mountain clear blue fountain burma shave
topics.phrase: In the cavern’s dark, as the inside of a mountain, down the hall a clear blue fountain waits - Burma Shave.

topics.query: earth god gnilda statue staff of light
topics.phrase: Before the statue of the Earth-god Gnilda, search to find a Staff of Light.

topics.query: ominous beasts cave in bones rusted armor
topics.phrase: From all directions come ominous beasts, and beyond a cave-in lie broken bones and rusted armor.
Search each passage and room; three clues lie hidden where the riddle points.
Choose the single right road or your quest you will forsake.

YEW.name: Ariadne
YEW.description: A meticulous dungeon cartographer of Llylgamyn

topics.phrase: I'm a dungeon cartographer who maps teleporter light illusions, finds hidden doors with milwa and lomilwa, and charts anti-magic zones in Llylgamyn.

topics.query: teleporter light lomilwa milwa mapping corridors
topics.phrase: Teleporter light can trick mapping - how do teleporter light and lomilwa or milwa change corridor mapping in your experience?

topics.query: hidden doors milwa lomilwa detection mapping
topics.phrase: For hidden doors, I keep milwa or lomilwa active - what hidden doors detection tricks improve mapping accuracy?

topics.query: anti-magic bug expedition spells monsters affected
topics.phrase: Have you exploited the anti-magic bug where the anti-magic area follows you, leaving expedition spells intact and monsters affected?

topics.query: armor riddle malor three squares east
topics.phrase: The armor riddle implies you must malor three squares east - how do you plot that malor jump on your map?

topics.query: WIZICORP wishes 5000 gp well teleport town
topics.phrase: Ever used the WIZICORP well - wishes 5000 gp - to teleport back to town mid-expedition?

YEW.name: Brother Latumapic
YEW.description: A soft-spoken Bishop who identifies unknown items, safely handles cursed gear

topics.phrase: I'm a Bishop appraiser who identifies unknown items, manages cursed items, and keeps latumapic at the ready for safe adventuring.

topics.query: latumapic mahaman katino montino stars favorable
topics.phrase: The stars are favorable - latumapic, mahaman, katino, and montino behave differently; how do you use these stars-favorable shifts?

topics.query: identify unknown items cursed items bishop delete recreate
topics.phrase: As a Bishop, I identify unknown items. how do you manage cursed items?
Once you have the Knight of Diamonds shield, dialma becomes your unlimited healing - how do you ration the shield dialma in long delves?

topics.query: one alone sphinx riddle Knight of Diamonds
topics.phrase: Facing the sphinx with one alone for the Knight of Diamonds - what’s your ritual for that riddle encounter?
Ever had a foe shout “Mapiro Mahama Diromat” - how do you counter that incantation when it echoes through the hall?

YEW.name: Sir Hrathnir
YEW.description: A class-changed Samurai named for the Magic Sword Hrathnir

topics.phrase: I'm a Samurai swordmaster, mentoring class changes and party composition for efficient endgame progression.

topics.query: three roads choose wisely forsake the quest
topics.phrase: When the dungeon offers three forking roads - choose wisely lest you forsake the quest - how do you evaluate those forks?

topics.query: Magic Sword Hrathnir fixed encounter Level III
topics.phrase: Tell me about the Magic Sword Hrathnir encounter on the third level - what prep do you bring for Hrathnir?

topics.query: KOD Helm Gauntlets Shield Armor fixed encounter
topics.phrase: For Knight of Diamond pieces - Helm, Gauntlets, Shield, Armor - fixed encounters can be brutal; which fixed encounters do you tackle first?

topics.query: thief to ninja chests traps early Wizardry
topics.phrase: Did you flip a thief to ninja early, and how do you handle chests and traps when ninjas can’t disarm reliably?

topics.query: cavern's dark inside of a mountain clear blue fountain
topics.phrase: In that cavern’s dark, as the inside of a mountain, did you scout the clear blue fountain or avoid it altogether?

YEW.name: Caliphar
YEW.description: A wisened sage who barters secret lore

topics.phrase: I am the wisened sage who sells lore for 100,000 gold and explains why the stars now favor silence, sleep, latumapic, and mahaman.

topics.query: 100000 gold wisened sage study dusty books
topics.phrase: For 100,000 gold, the wisened sage in a study of dusty books reveals much - what questions would you pay 100000 gold to answer?

topics.query: riddle answer shield magic shield KOD
topics.phrase: On riddles, the answer shield leads to the Magic Shield Knight of Diamonds - how did you deduce the shield answer under pressure?

topics.query: sphinx clues king worships gold power doom treasure room
topics.phrase: The sphinx clues - the king worships gold and power, treasure room and doom - how do you stitch those king clues into one solution?

topics.query: ominous sounds hungry wild beasts stalactites cavern
topics.phrase: When ominous sounds of hungry wild beasts echo from stalactites in the cavern, what party formation do you hold?

topics.query: panel slams shut behind you trap
topics.phrase: Have you been caught where a panel slams shut behind you - what trap discipline keeps the party safe?

BARAD_ENELETH.name: Lyrra
BARAD_ENELETH.description: A vigilant moat warden and beach sentry

topics.phrase: I am the moat warden and beach sentry, guarding the fortress and barracks while keeping watch on the lake and its island.
At the barracks by the fortress, I always remind recruits to BEWARE OF MOAT MONSTERS before they cross the parapets.
From the beach beside the dark lake I watch that small island for ripples and shadows from the waters edge.
Don't step past the water's edge or you'll drown - I've hauled too many back.
I am the grand wizard’s scribe and archivist, tending the office, dining room, kitchen, boudoir, cellar and that desk with the ornate letter P.
At S.E.G. Po'le's door the placard shouts THE WIZARD IS *OUT* DO NOT ENTER, and I make sure no one enters.
The grand dining room connects north to the kitchen and south to the wizard's opulent boudoir, all under my care.
I file petitions in the large dusty desk inlaid with an ornate letter 'P'.
Mind the wine cellar; vintage tomes and vintages both are stored with equal reverence.

Welcome, traveler - may the winds of the desert be at your back and the sun leave you always in shade. I run Abdul’s routes, dispatching the Ethereal Taxi and selling rarities like the Rod of Fire to those with the right password and the right price.
For Abdul's Ethereal Taxi Service fares, it’s 2500 when you’re close and 5000 when you’ve really wandered.
If someone challenges you, just tell them Abdul sent you - say 'ABDUL SENT YOU' as the password.
Open the jewel encrusted coffer and behold the Rod of Fire - 25000, and not a coin less.

BARAD_ENELETH.name: Orin
BARAD_ENELETH.description: Custodian of the radiant statue and keeper of riddles who trades in crystals, orbs, and answers.

topics.phrase: I am the statue-warden and riddlemaster, overseeing trades of crystals and orbs while testing seekers with AIR, DEATH, and the WHEEL.
At the radiant statue with hands outstretched, I mind the shining crystal sphere and the empty palm that aches to trade.
Hear the riddle: I am around you always, never seen, and you would never leave me - AIR.
Tarot whispers: black figure on a black horse with the white rose; the rising sun - change will come - DEATH.
On my roll you move forward; my turn is your turn - turn the WHEEL and watch fate pivot.

MONTOR.name: Mentorian
MONTOR.description: A vigilant moat warden and beach sentry

topics.phrase: I am the moat warden and beach sentry, guarding the fortress and barracks while keeping watch on the lake and its island.
At the barracks by the fortress, I always remind recruits to BEWARE OF MOAT MONSTERS before they cross the parapets.
From the beach beside the dark lake I watch that small island for ripples and shadows from the waters edge.
Don't step past the water's edge or you'll drown - I've hauled too many back.
